DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine inhale nitric oxide improve short long term respiratory outcome preterm infant . The dose decrease per protocol respiratory support discontinue . Infants follow evaluate safety efficacy non-invasive iNO delivery , 12 month correct gestational age .
DOC.brief_title: Study Inhaled Nitric Oxide Respiratory Outcomes Late Preterm Infants
DOC.criteria: < 48 hour age , 30 36 week gestational age birth base best estimate use obstetrical sonography ( first second trimester ) , solid dating criterion , Ballard examination , Birth weight ≥ 1,000 g , 5 minute Apgar score ≥5 , Requiring nasal cannula O2 > 1LPM , CPAP , NIPPV treatment respiratory failure , Requiring fraction inspire oxygen ( FIO2 ) least 0.25 maintain SaO2 8894 % , Parent guardian sign informed consent agrees study related procedure , include require hospital discharge . Major congenital anomaly Intubation surfactant delivery room prior enrollment NICU . Excludes intubation suction . Known congenital infection ( bacterial , viral ) , Perinatal asphyxia ( 5 minute Apgar < 5 , umbilical artery pH < 7.0 evidence neonatal encephalopathy ) , Mother and/or infant enrol another clinical trial ( exclude observational ) receive investigational drug , Has undergone anticipate require major surgical procedure within first 48 h life , Any condition could preclude receive study drug perform studyrelated procedure , Use postnatal corticosteroid , Parent guardian unable unwilling complete study procedure hospital discharge .
